Name: 1. Origin Story
PROMPT: Tell me about the origin story of [company]. What was the lightbulb moment for you?

Name: 2. Company-building hot take
PROMPT:
What’s one company-building belief you have that others disagree with you on?
Examples:

Name: 3. Industry hot take V1
PROMPT: What's one [category] belief you have that others disagree with you on?

Name: 4. Hiring Philosophy Post
PROMPT: How do you think about hiring at [company]? How are some recent hires?

Name: 5. Company Update (Monthly)
PROMPT: What were the top 3 wins from the past month? Top 3 learnings? What’s next for [company] in [next month]? Any growth metrics stand out that we can cite in the hook?

Name: 6. Culture Building & Core Values
PROMPT: How do you think about building culture at [company]? What are the core values of your culture? What are the most overrated and underrated aspects of 'building culture' in startups?

Name: 7. Customer/Prospect call anecdote + hot take
PROMPT: Tell me about a recent conversation you've had with a customer or prospect that stood out to you. It could be something surprising that they said, an objection they had, etc.

Name: 8. Industry hot take V2
PROMPT: What's another hot take or polarizing opinion you have on [category]? Where do you think everyone else is wrong? Why? Data or specific anecdotes to back this up would be amazing.

Name: 9. Overcoming adversity narrative post
PROMPT: What has been the biggest 'oh shit' moment in growing [company] so far? How did you overcome it? How has it influenced the way you continue to grow [company] going forward?

Name: 10. Feature curation
PROMPT: Can you get us a list of every feature you've shipped in the past X months? Of these, which are most compelling to your ICP? We ideally want 10-15+ to include here. The goal is to show shipping velocity.

Name: 11. TOFU resources curation (book)
PROMPT: What’s one book that impacted the way you view company-building? If you're not a huge book reader, could be a podcast, newsletter, video lecture, etc. The goal here is to 'borrow credibility' from a notable name to stop the scroll. For example, lessons from a Steve Jobs biography you read. Also great if we can tie the lessons from the book into a real lesson of how you used them to scale your company.

Name: 12. [Category topic] Checklist
PROMPT: Run me through a detailed checklist of how to [category-related task]. What are the specific steps required to achieve [desired outcome]?

Name: 13. ICP pain points listicle
PROMPT: What are the top 3-5 problems or pain points your ICP runs into when trying to [achieve the desired outcome]? Why do these problems exist?

Name: 14. Value-based listicle
PROMPT: What are 3-5 things you wish you knew before you got into [category]?

Name: 15. Case Study
PROMPT: We'll pull a case study from the client's site and format into a LinkedIn post that feels social-native.

Name: 16. Off-site recap post
PROMPT: You recently had an off-site in [location]. What were the biggest learnings that came out of the event? Did anything surprise you? How do you think about running a productive off-site?

Name: 17. ICP Mistakes Listicle
PROMPT: What are the top 3-5 mistakes that keep [ICP] from [ideal outcome]?

Name: 18. ICP tech stack curation
PROMPT: Run me through all the tech and tools a [ICP] needs in their tech stack.

Name: 19. Difficult customer/client narrative post (MOFU)
PROMPT: Tell me about a time when you had a difficult customer and made it work. Bonus points if we can find an example where you or your team went above and beyond for the customer. How did this experience influence the way you run [company] now?

Name: 20. Difficult customer/client narrative post (BOFU)
PROMPT: Tell me about a time when you had a difficult customer and made it work. Bonus points if we can find an example where you or your team went above and beyond for the customer. Tie this narrative into a specific product feature you built (more bottom of funnel than the previous prompt).

Name: 21. Outstanding Hire Highlight
PROMPT: Tell me about one hire you've made at [company] who has blown away your expectations. What are the characteristics that make them a strong hire and culture fit for [company]? Give me an example of these traist in action (bonus points if you have specififc, quantifiable data).

Name: 22.  ICP mistake/myth (single item)
PROMPT: What's one mistake or myth that keeps [ICP] from [achieving ideal outcome]? What should they do instead? Please give me a specific example or anecdote that exemplifies this. Ideally, we want to tie this to a pain point or issue that [company] solves, without the post feeling 'salesy.’

Name: 23. ICP-related template
PROMPT: During your time as [ICP], what was one template or framework you found yourself relying on? Walk me through the components of it. Bonus points if you have any examples or quantifiable data from this working well for you.

Name: 24. Sales Calls Trends
PROMPT: You're on a lot of sales calls and networking calls with [ICP]. What is a trend you've heard over the past 2-3 weeks that has caught your attention? This could be something that excites you or something that concerns you.

Name: 25. Underrated Feature Highlight
PROMPT: What's one thing you wish more people knew about [product]? Any anecdotes or case studies we can cite in this post that would make it more compelling?

Name: 26. Lightbulb Moment Narrative
PROMPT: What made you decide to take the jump from [previous role] to starting your own business? At what point did you know you were ‘ready?’

Name: 27. Industry Predictions (listicle)
PROMPT: What do you think the [ICP] role will look like in [category] in the year 2030? Give me at least 3 specific predictions (each will be its own post).

Name: 28. Industry Predictions (single item)
PROMPT: Take one of the items from prompt 27 (or a new one) and expand on it into a single post. Bonus points if you have a narrative, or data, to back up the prediction.

Name: 29. Right VS Wrong Way
PROMPT: What is the right way to [industry-related task]? What is the wrong way to [industry-related task]? Contrasting the two in a post tends to do well.

Name: 30. Trend-jacking
PROMPT: What [category] news has caught your attention lately? Is there a new release or development that [ICP] should be aware of? What is your take on this?

Name: 31. Overcoming Common Objection
PROMPT: What's one objection you've been getting from prospects lately? Can you tell me about a customer story or any data that overcomes this objective? We want to create a narrative post that overcomes this objection.

Name: 32. Changing Industry Opinion
PROMPT: What's one idea in [category] that you've changed your mind on in the past 12 months? Why? Can you give me a story or anecdote that exemplifies this?

Name: 33. ICP Framework
PROMPT: What's your favorite framework for [ICP-related task]? What are the steps to execute this? Can you give me an example of a time (or times) you've executed this in a previous position? The goal here is to make this post value-dense so someone in your ICP will either share it or bookmark it.

Name: 34. Personal Interest Post
PROMPT: Tell me about an interest or hobby you have outside of company-building. This could be endurance sports, playing a musical instrument, etc. It can be a lifelong pursuit or something you've picked up more recently. How has that impacted you as a founder?

Name: 35. Industry Resources Curation
PROMPT: What are your favorite resources for staying up-to-date in [category]? Give me a quick blurb on why you like each one. We want to make this a list of 5-10 resources. Tagging the creators will also help to increase distribution of the post.

Name: 36. Industry Lies
PROMPT: What are the 7 biggest lies told about [category] on LinkedIn? Think about talking points that you see come up over and over that drive you nuts. Bonus points if you can provide any examples or anecdotes.

Name: 36. Core Category Beliefs
PROMPT: What are 5 core beliefs you have about [category]? Can you give me a quick blurb on why you believe each one? Bonus points if you have specific examples, data, or anecdotes that exemplify this.

Name: 37. Asked For Advice
PROMPT: What are the top 5-10 pieces of advice you find yourself giving to [ICP]? The goal is to turn this into a listicle with a story-based hook along the lines of “I was asked for advice on how to [do ICP-related task]…”

Name: 38. Product Pillars
PROMPT: What are 2-3 guiding principles that influence the way you’ve built [PRODUCT]? Where did you learn these? Can you tell me about a specific story in which the principles influenced a product decision?

Name: 39. Overrated Industry Advice
PROMPT: What’s the most overrated piece of [CATEGORY] advice you’ve heard of lately? What’s your actual belief?

Name: 40. Easy Wins Post
PROMPT: What are the most common reasons [ICP] would refuse to do [product-related action]? What are 1-3 easy wins you can give them in a LinkedIn post? This will help you build trust with your ICP and get them moving in a direction towards a buying decision. Sort of a variation of an ‘overcoming objections’ post.

Name: 41. Best Customer Characteristics
PROMPT: What are 1-3 characteristics of your best customers? Do you have any stories or anecdotes that would exemplify this? The goal is to use this post as a magnet for your best customers, and repel those who aren’t a good fit.

Name: 42. VC vs Bootstrapping (Your Decision)
PROMPT: Why did you decide to raise venture capital? How did you pick the right investors to work with? If you're bootstrapped, why didn’t you raise VC? Was this always a direction you wanted to follow?

Name: 43. Customer Support Highlight
PROMPT: Can you share an example of a customer review or Slack message that exemplifies the great CX they had with [product]? How do you think about providing a stellar CX at [company]? Preferably, include a screenshot of the review with this post.

Name: 44. Podcast Recap
PROMPT: Tell me about one podcast you listened to recently (ideally one that’s industry-specific). What were your top 1-3 takeaways? If you don’t listen to podcasts, a newsletter or book can be used for the same style of post. Include a screenshot of the episode cover or a clip from the episode as the media asset.

Name: 45. Sales FAQ
PROMPT: What’s one of the most common questions you get asked on sales calls (or that your team gets asked) before prospects commit to signing up? What is your typical answer? Bonus points if you have specific anecdotes or data to back this up.

Name: 46. What’s working right now?
PROMPT: What are 1-5 trends you're seeing work well in [category]? Can you give specific examples or data to back this up? This is a good post format to cycle through once every 1-2 months. Great post format to use if you have access to a lot of industry data.

Name: 47. Dog-fooding
PROMPT: Do you use your own product? What are your biggest takeaways from your own experience? Bonus if you can position the post as hitting a milestone with your product (see https://www.linkedin.com/posts/tyler-denk_i-started-this-newsletter-in-january-to-build-activity-7201617643970117633-R0bk?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop).

Name: 48. Template Giveaway
PROMPT: Is there a template or document that you find yourself using often in your day-to-day as an [ICP]? What are the components of it? Do you have a story or anecdote of a time when you used it and it was a lifesaver? You can also give away the template as a lead magnet (see https://www.linkedin.com/posts/ben-sharf-b554a5b3_remote-work-is-killing-company-culture-but-activity-7216479710929666049-tTpD?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop).

Name: 49. Hiring Traits
PROMPT: What’s one trait you look for in every new hire you make? Bonus points if this trait is unique to your company and something others might not agree with you on. Who’s one hire you’ve made that embodies this trait?

Name: 50. Industry Event Recap
PROMPT: You attended [industry event] recently. What were your 3-5 biggest takeaways? Did you meet any people or have any conversations that stood out to you? Include pictures in this post!

Name: 51. What I Wish I Knew (Founder edition)
PROMPT: What are 1-3 things you wish you knew before becoming a founder?

Name: 52. Industry Deep Dive
PROMPT: Is there a company or event in your industry that has caught your attention lately? This is a great opportunity to do a deep dive and borrow some of their credibility to stop the scroll.

Name: 53. Industry Examples (Listicle)
PROMPT: What are 5 companies in your industry that do [ICP activity] the right way? What do you love about their approach? We’ll turn this into a listicle style post for LinkedIn.

Name: 54. Industry Prediction
PROMPT: What’s one prediction you have about [category] in the next 1-5 years? 5-10+?

Name: 55. Team Growth
PROMPT: How has the grow of the team from X → XX over the past X months changed you as a founder? What are the key learnings?

Name: 56. Founder learnings
PROMPT: You’ve been building company for [timeframe]. What are the top 3-5 lessons you’ve learned over that time? Make these as specific and unique to your experience as possible. Bonus points if you have anecdotes that support these lessons.

Name: 57. Day-in-the-life
PROMPT: What does a typical day in the life look like for you as a founder? Run me through the hour by hour calendar.

Name: 58. Top 1% Characteristics
PROMPT: What do the top 1% of [ICP] do that the other 99% miss entirely?

Name: 59. Company Momentum Post
PROMPT: What’s one highlight or stat that you can share that shows [company]’s momentum? Bonus points if you have a team pic or other relevant image that can do with this

Name: 60. New Integration Announcement
PROMPT: Tell me about this new [XXXX] integration. What does it mean for customers? Why did you build it into [product]? Why launch it now?

Name: 61. Co-Founder Origin Story
PROMPT: How did you meet you co-founder? What made you two a strong fit? Is there a specific anecdote or memory from the early days that highlights this?

Name: 62. Customer Highlight
PROMPT: I don’t have a specific ‘question’ for this one. But, what you’ll want to do is find a customer on your roster and do a breakdown on a strategy of theirs that you love. The goal is for this to be middle-of-funnel, not a product pitch. See the example for more inspiration.

Name: 63. Founder Salary Thoughts
PROMPT: How do (or did) you approach paying yourself as a startup founder? What did the progression look like? This prompt tends to work best with second-time founders sharing their experience from the first company (so the information is not as sensitive).

Name: 64. 2nd Time Founder Evolution
PROMPT: (For 2nd time founders) What are you doing differently with [new company] that you  didn’t do with [first company]?

Name: 65. Remote Work Philosophy
PROMPT: When building [company], why did you choose to go fully remote? How do you build culture in a remote company? Inverse this question if the company is in office.

Name: 66. Industry Job Curation
PROMPT: Compile a list of 10-15 roles in your category. Create a listicle post curating them. Tag the companies (and team members when relevant). These types of posts tend to get circulated a ton. You can make this a recurring (weekly or monthly) format.

Name: 67. Workflow Walkthrough (fan favorite)
PROMPT: Can you walk me through one of the more popular use cases of your product? Pair this with a Loom walkthrough that can be posted with the copy.

Name: 68. Workflow Walkthrough (underrated)
PROMPT: Can you walk me through one of the more underrated cases of your product? Pair this with a Loom walkthrough that can be posted with the copy. Similar to the previous prompt, but this post should be more about highlighting a feature that doesn’t get much love.

Name: 69. Hypothetical Scenario
PROMPT: How would you [achieve ICP ideal outcome] if you had to start from scratch?

Name: 70. Customer Story [MOFU tactics]
PROMPT: Tell me about a recent success story you’ve had with a customer. What were the learnings from it? What strategies and tactics did you use to get them this win? The angle for this post should be more ‘middle of funnel’ sharing strategies and tactics your ICP finds helpful.

Name: 71. Challenge ICP Assumptions
PROMPT: What does [ICP] think they need to [achieve ideal outcome]? What do they actually need to [achieve ideal outcome]?

Name: 72. Industry Advice Listicle
PROMPT: What are your 5 best pieces of advice for ICP? Make these as tactical and unique to you as possible (avoid generic fluff).

Name: 73. Competition
PROMPT: How do you think about competition when building [company]? Do you pay attention to competitors at all? Why or why not?

Name: 74. Industry Trend Observation
PROMPT: What’s one trend you're seeing in [category] right now? Bonus points if you can offer any anecdotes or data to support your observations here.

Name: 75. Conference Keynote Recap
PROMPT: Did you or a key team member speak at any conferences lately? What were the main takeaways of their talk? Include an image or video with this post.

Name: 76. Category Meme
PROMPT: Create a simple meme highlighting a customer pain point. Memes are a great way to communicate ideas in a simple, shareable format.

Name: 77. Outdated Practice
PROMPT: What’s one commonly done practice in [category] that you think should be done differently? Why?

Name: 78. Common Talking Point Commentary
PROMPT: What’s one idea that a lot of [ICPs] talk about, but don’t understand completely? How should they really be thinking about it?

Name: 79. AI Predictions
PROMPT: How will AI impact [category]? What should be savviest [ICPs] do to prepare for this? How will the [ICP] role evolve as a result?

Name: 80. Warning Signs
PROMPT: What are 5-10 signs that [ICP] is set up for failure? How would you address this?

Name: 81. Building In Public
PROMPT: Give me a quick update on some wins, learnings, etc from the past week building [company]. These could be new hires, new feature rollouts, new logos, etc. Sharing specific metrics and examples tends to make these posts work better. Also, include an image.
